Method Detail

sfStart

public void sfStart()
             throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
Startup:
  1. Bind to the destination directory
  2. deploy and start the startup component if present
  3. deploy but do not start the shutdown component if present
  4. start the worker thread that accepts queued copy operations

    5. Specified by:
    sfStart in interface org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.Prim
    Overrides:
    sfStart in class org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.PrimImpl
    Throws:
    org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - for deployment problems
    java.rmi.RemoteException - RMI problems

handle liveness check by throwing any fault received in the worker thread, then checking the health of the startup component.

sfTerminateWith

public void sfTerminateWith(org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.TerminationRecord status)
Termination logic. At terminate time, we shutdown the copy thread, then kill the startup prim. If shutdown was not null, it is started and then immediately terminated (so it had better do its work in the start component)

Overrides:
sfTerminateWith in class org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.PrimImpl
Parameters:
status -

queueCopy

protected QueuedFile queueCopy(java.io.File sourceFile,
                               java.lang.String destinationName)
                        throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogDeploymentException
copy the file. This may be blocking or not, depending on the settings

Parameters:
sourceFile - the file to copy
destinationName - short name of the destination file
Returns:
the file (which may or may not be copied yet; it depends on the async flag)
Throws:
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogDeploymentException - if the IO failed
